pull_request.title: Possibility to enforce contact addition in ContactManager even if there are no subscribers

update.description:
This is only a small change which allows more flexibility in the use of ``PhysicsEngine`` (more specifically the ``ContactManager`` which it provides).

Currently the policy is that contacts are only processed further if there are subscribers to the contacts topic. Method [ContactMangaer::NewContact()](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/commits/2251e3885184c88099722869a34d552198e5c728#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.hhF99T102) is used by all the ``PhysicsEngine`` implementations to notify about new found contacts. If an object (not NULL) is returned, the contacts processing continues in the ``PhysicsEngine`` implementations, and ``ContactManager`` will have the full information available. However if there are no subscribers, NewContact() returns NULL, effectively skipping to keep the contact point information.

It is important (for performance reasons) to have a means to skip further processing, and having the subscriber criterion is one way to proclaim interest in more information about the contacts. However it would be great to have another option to proclaim this interest and allow contacts processing, without the need to create a subscriber to the topic.
This PR addresses this by adding a method [ContactManager::SetEnforceContacts(true)](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/commits/2251e3885184c88099722869a34d552198e5c728#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.hhT108)  which allows to enforce the contact point handling even if there are no subscribers. By default this behaviour is disabled, so the changes will not have any effects on previous applications which do not explicitly call this function with true.

Example use case: In the physics engine test framework I'm working on at the moment, I use PhysicsEngine directly and have no subscribers or publishers to communicate with the core Gazebo code. In the tests I need to get the contact points information. I would prefer not having to create a fake subscriber just to be able to get this information out of ContactManager interface. Other users may need the same feature.
update.title: Possibility to enforce contact addition in ContactManager even if there are no subscribers

content.html: I like StoreAll, though it does suggest that at other times not all contacts are stored, but it's either all or none contacts are stored... So NeverDrop makes more sense

update.description:
This is only a small change which allows more flexibility in the use of ``PhysicsEngine`` (more specifically the ``ContactManager`` which it provides).

Currently the policy is that contacts are only processed further if there are subscribers to the contacts topic. Method [ContactMangaer::NewContact()](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/commits/2251e3885184c88099722869a34d552198e5c728#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.hhF99T102) is used by all the ``PhysicsEngine`` implementations to notify about new found contacts. If an object (not NULL) is returned, the contacts processing continues in the ``PhysicsEngine`` implementations, and ``ContactManager`` will have the full information available. However if there are no subscribers, NewContact() returns NULL, effectively skipping to keep the contact point information.

It is important (for performance reasons) to have a means to skip further processing, and having the subscriber criterion is one way to proclaim interest in more information about the contacts. However it would be great to have another option to proclaim this interest and allow contacts processing, without the need to create a subscriber to the topic.
This PR addresses this by adding a method [ContactManager::SetEnforceContacts(true)](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/commits/2251e3885184c88099722869a34d552198e5c728#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.hhT108)  which allows to enforce the contact point handling even if there are no subscribers. Example use case: In the physics engine test framework I'm working on at the moment, I use PhysicsEngine directly and have no subscribers or publishers to communicate with the core Gazebo code. In the tests I need to get the contact points information. I would prefer not having to create a fake subscriber just to be able to get this information out of ContactManager interface. pull_request.title: Possibility to enforce contact addition in ContactManager even if there are no subscribers

pullrequest.title: Possibility to enforce contact addition in ContactManager even if there are no subscribers

content.raw:
This is a great idea, but the name of the function doesn't seem quite right. "Enforcing contacts" sounds like something done by the constraint solver in the physics engine, while the `ContactManager` stores contact information for use by contact sensors, contact filters, and GUI visualization.

"Don't ignore contacts" sounds right, but I'm not sure if it's quite concise enough. Or `MaximizeStorage` to indicate that it try to store all contacts possible?
content.html:
This is a great idea, but the name of the function doesn't seem quite right. "Enforcing contacts" sounds like something done by the constraint solver in the physics engine, while the ContactManager stores contact information for use by contact sensors, contact filters, and GUI visualization.

"Don't ignore contacts" sounds right, but I'm not sure if it's quite concise enough. Or MaximizeStorage to indicate that it try to store all contacts possible?

content.raw:
Thanks for spotting this. I also added it to the old method NewContacts() which was missing the ``param[in]``.

Sometimes I forget to add the documentation if it's obvious what the parameters are, but I really appreciate
complete documentation myself so it's great to have this style guides and strictly stick to them. Thanks!
content.html:
Thanks for spotting this. I also added it to the old method NewContacts() which was missing the param[in].

Sometimes I forget to add the documentation if it's obvious what the parameters are, but I really appreciate complete documentation myself so it's great to have this style guides and strictly stick to them. Thanks!

content.raw:
Could you add `param[in] _colission1`, `param[in] _collision2` and `param[in] _enforce`? We usually follow this structure:

```
#!c++

\brief
\param
...
\return
```
Take a look at `SubscribersConnected()` and `GetCustomPublishers()` too.
content.html:
Could you add param[in] _colission1, param[in] _collision2 and param[in] _enforce? We usually follow this structure:

\brief
\param
...
\return

Take a look at SubscribersConnected() and GetCustomPublishers() too.

pull_request.title: Possibility to enforce contact addition in ContactManager even if there are no subscribers

update.description:
This is only a small change which allows more flexibility in the use of ``PhysicsEngine`` (more specifically the ``ContactManager`` which it provides).

Currently the policy is that contacts are only processed further if there are subscribers to the contacts topic. Method [ContactMangaer::NewContact()](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/commits/2251e3885184c88099722869a34d552198e5c728#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.hhF99T102) is used by all the ``PhysicsEngine`` implementations to notify about new found contacts. If an object (not NULL) is returned, the contacts processing continues in the ``PhysicsEngine`` implementations, and ``ContactManager`` will have the full information available. However if there are no subscribers, NewContact() returns NULL, effectively skipping to keep the contact point information.

It is important (for performance reasons) to have a means to skip further processing, and having the subscriber criterion is one way to proclaim interest in more information about the contacts. However it would be great to have another option to proclaim this interest and allow contacts processing, without the need to create a subscriber to the topic.
This PR addresses this by adding a method [ContactManager::SetEnforceContacts(true)](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/commits/2251e3885184c88099722869a34d552198e5c728#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.hhT108)  which allows to enforce the contact point handling even if there are no subscribers. By default this behaviour is disabled, so the changes will not have any effects on previous applications which do not explicitly call this function with true.

Example use case: In the physics engine test framework I'm working on at the moment, I use PhysicsEngine directly and have no subscribers or publishers to communicate with the core Gazebo code. In the tests I need to get the contact points information. I would prefer not having to create a fake subscriber just to be able to get this information out of ContactManager interface. Other users may need the same feature.
update.title: Possibility to enforce contact addition in ContactManager even if there are no subscribers

pull_request.title: Possibility to enforce contact addition in ContactManager even if there are no subscribers

pullrequest.title: Possibility to enforce contact addition in ContactManager even if there are no subscribers

content.raw:
Update: I also added a new function [ContactManager::SubscribersConnected()](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/diff/gazebo/physics/ContactManager.hh?diff2=0098d8d9839f&at=contact_manager_enforcable_additions#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.hhT131) in a separate branch [contact_manager_enforcable_additions](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/src/0098d8d9839fb5bc856a5dfe3d01efcd64564f74/gazebo/?at=contact_manager_enforcable_additions). This can be used ahead of calling NewContact() in case it's necessary to know whether
contacts are to be handled at all (i.e. if NewContact won't return NULL). I am trying to fix an issue with ODE not publishing contacts for objects which haven't moved in a while, and need this function for that.

Also added a helper function for NewContact() to keep it tidier and stumbled over a possible issue, see comment in [this line in ContactManager.cc](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/diff/gazebo/physics/ContactManager.cc?diff2=0098d8d9839f&at=contact_manager_enforcable_additions#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.ccT211).

I can update this PR with the additional changes but thought to keep it simple for now.
content.html:
Update: I also added a new function ContactManager::SubscribersConnected() in a separate branch contact_manager_enforcable_additions. This can be used ahead of calling NewContact() in case it's necessary to know whether contacts are to be handled at all (i.e. if NewContact won't return NULL). I am trying to fix an issue with ODE not publishing contacts for objects which haven't moved in a while, and need this function for that.

Also added a helper function for NewContact() to keep it tidier and stumbled over a possible issue, see comment in this line in ContactManager.cc.

I can update this PR with the additional changes but thought to keep it simple for now.

pull_request.title: Possibility to enforce contact addition in ContactManager even if there are no subscribers

update.description:
This is only a small change which allows more flexibility in the use of ``PhysicsEngine`` (more specifically the ``ContactManager`` which it provides).

Currently the policy is that contacts are only processed further if there are subscribers to the contacts topic. Method [ContactMangaer::NewContact()](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/commits/2251e3885184c88099722869a34d552198e5c728#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.hhF99T102) is used by all the ``PhysicsEngine`` implementations to notify about new found contacts. If an object (not NULL) is returned, the contacts processing continues in the ``PhysicsEngine`` implementations, and ``ContactManager`` will have the full information available. However if there are no subscribers, NewContact() returns NULL, effectively skipping to keep the contact point information.

It is important (for performance reasons) to have a means to skip further processing, and having the subscriber criterion is one way to proclaim interest in more information about the contacts. However it would be great to have another option to proclaim this interest and allow contacts processing, without the need to create a subscriber to the topic.
This PR addresses this by adding a method [ContactManager::SetEnforceContacts(true)](https://bitbucket.org/JenniferBuehler/gazebo/commits/2251e3885184c88099722869a34d552198e5c728#Lgazebo/physics/ContactManager.hhT108)  which allows to enforce the contact point handling even if there are no subscribers. By default this behaviour is disabled, so the changes will not have any effects on previous applications which do not explicitly call this function with true.

Example use case: In the physics engine test framework I'm working on at the moment, I use PhysicsEngine directly and have no subscribers or publishers to communicate with the core Gazebo code. In the tests I need to get the contact points information. I would prefer not having to create a fake subscriber just to be able to get this information out of ContactManager interface. Other users may need the same feature.
